verses.plain: He that loveth his son causeth him oft to feel the rod, that he may have joy of him in the end.

tokens.t: He that loveth his son causeth him oft to feel the rod, that he may have joy of him in the end.

verses.plain: He that chastiseth his son shall have joy in him, and shall rejoice of him among his acquaintance.

tokens.t: He that chastiseth his son shall have joy in him, and shall rejoice of him among his acquaintance.

verses.plain: He that teacheth his son grieveth the enemy: and before his friends he shall rejoice of him.

tokens.t: He that teacheth his son grieveth the enemy: and before his friends he shall rejoice of him.

verses.plain: Though his father die, yet he is as though he were not dead: for he hath left one behind him that is like himself.

tokens.t: Though his father die, yet he is as though he were not dead: for he hath left one behind him that is like himself.

verses.plain: While he lived, he saw and rejoiced in him: and when he died, he was not sorrowful.

tokens.t: While he lived, he saw and rejoiced in him: and when he died, he was not sorrowful.

verses.plain: He left behind him an avenger against his enemies, and one that shall requite kindness to his friends.

tokens.t: He left behind him an avenger against his enemies, and one that shall requite kindness to his friends.

verses.plain: He that maketh too much of his son shall bind up his wounds; and his bowels will be troubled at every cry.

tokens.t: He that maketh too much of his son shall bind up his wounds; and his bowels will be troubled at every cry.

verses.plain: An horse not broken becometh headstrong: and a child left to himself will be wilful.

tokens.t: An horse not broken becometh headstrong: and a child left to himself will be wilful.

verses.plain: Cocker thy child, and he shall make thee afraid: play with him, and he will bring thee to heaviness.

tokens.t: Cocker thy child, and he shall make thee afraid: play with him, and he will bring thee to heaviness.

verses.plain: Laugh not with him, lest thou have sorrow with him, and lest thou gnash thy teeth in the end.

tokens.t: Laugh not with him, lest thou have sorrow with him, and lest thou gnash thy teeth in the end.

verses.plain: Give him no liberty in his youth, and wink not at his follies.

tokens.t: Give him no liberty in his youth, and wink not at his follies.

verses.plain: Bow down his neck while he is young, and beat him on the sides while he is a child, lest he wax stubborn, and be disobedient unto thee, and so bring sorrow to thine heart.

tokens.t: Bow down his neck while he is young, and beat him on the sides while he is a child, lest he wax stubborn, and be disobedient unto thee, and so bring sorrow to thine heart.

verses.plain: Chastise thy son, and hold him to labour, lest his lewd behaviour be an offence unto thee.

tokens.t: Chastise thy son, and hold him to labour, lest his lewd behaviour be an offence unto thee.

verses.plain: Better is the poor, being sound and strong of constitution, than a rich man that is afflicted in his body.

tokens.t: Better is the poor, being sound and strong of constitution, than a rich man that is afflicted in his body.

verses.plain: Health and good estate of body are above all gold, and a strong body above infinite wealth.

tokens.t: Health and good estate of body are above all gold, and a strong body above infinite wealth.

verses.plain: There is no riches above a sound body, and no joy above the joy of the heart.

tokens.t: There is no riches above a sound body, and no joy above the joy of the heart.

verses.plain: Death is better than a bitter life or continual sickness.

tokens.t: Death is better than a bitter life or continual sickness.

verses.plain: Delicates poured upon a mouth shut up are as messes of meat set upon a grave.

tokens.t: Delicates poured upon a mouth shut up are as messes of meat set upon a grave.

verses.plain: What good doeth the offering unto an idol? for neither can it eat nor smell: so is he that is persecuted of the Lord.

tokens.t: What good doeth the offering unto an idol? for neither can it eat nor smell: so is he that is persecuted of the Lord.

verses.plain: He seeth with his eyes and groaneth, as an eunuch that embraceth a virgin and sigheth.

tokens.t: He seeth with his eyes and groaneth, as an eunuch that embraceth a virgin and sigheth.

verses.plain: Give not over thy mind to heaviness, and afflict not thyself in thine own counsel.

tokens.t: Give not over thy mind to heaviness, and afflict not thyself in thine own counsel.

verses.plain: The gladness of the heart is the life of man, and the joyfulness of a man prolongeth his days.

tokens.t: The gladness of the heart is the life of man, and the joyfulness of a man prolongeth his days.

verses.plain: Love thine own soul, and comfort thy heart, remove sorrow far from thee: for sorrow hath killed many, and there is no profit therein.

tokens.t: Love thine own soul, and comfort thy heart, remove sorrow far from thee: for sorrow hath killed many, and there is no profit therein.

verses.plain: Envy and wrath shorten the life, and carefulness bringeth age before the time.

tokens.t: Envy and wrath shorten the life, and carefulness bringeth age before the time.

verses.plain: A cheerful and good heart will have a care of his meat and diet.

tokens.t: A cheerful and good heart will have a care of his meat and diet.
